channel.title: Is my xbox dead forever?
channel.description:
Hey guys... Yesterday my xbox crashed when I played mw2... The control started to vibrate, and it came 3 red lights on the "turn on" button... I got really scared because I know about this problem, but... It is possible to fix? :)
Here is a picture on how it look now (btw, how can I make the picture smaller?): [IMG]http://i40.tinypic.com/2hwi6ip.jpg[/img] And here is a video: [youtube]http://youtu.be/nPcJVrSPR34[/youtube]
[u]NOTE: Please dont recommend me to buy a PS3 instead :P[/u]

item.title: Is my xbox dead forever?
item.dc:creator: @neroxx neroxx
item.description:
@neroxx wrote:

@CoonHunter: I have had this problem before, but it was because some cables was unplugged… so, yeah :L

Read full topic

item.title: Is my xbox dead forever?
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Every time I had this issue, it was just a simple unplug and replug back in. As suggested just unplug it for a little while. I had to buy a refurbished after my Xbox broke (power outage in middle of firmware update caused a brick) and ended up with a first gen. It does overheat on a hot day, crashes, and then I have to let it sit for a little while.

Read full topic

http://www.llamma.com/xbox360/repair/ring_of_light_x-clamp_fix.htm

On the old xbox, 3 red lights are almost always the xclamps/thermal paste/etc

require a heating fan gun to dry the thermal com-paste.

item.title: Is my xbox dead forever?
item.dc:creator: @neroxx neroxx
item.description:
@neroxx wrote:

[quote=“ultimatepkvillage, post:14, topic:433619”][quote author=Chassy13 link=topic=536338.msg3921392#msg3921392 date=1329751898]

get a ps3 and dont have to worry about this

A PS3 can still have hardware failure, it’s just a low-rate failure console. Not to mention my friend’s PS3 is a piece of garbage and won’t start half of the time.
[/quote]

Yea they can have hardware failure but those failure where mostly from the Fat Ps3 from dust build up inside the fans. I currently have the 160gb slim had it for 3 years no problems yet. And its unlikely for these ps3 console to get these failures for a long time. And the low-rate failure console is xbox dude that thing will overheat to easily ( it cost less 0= ).

Xbox Fix:

Don’t send it in not worth the money if they fix it, it probably will break down again or send a refurbished one back

Optional Try and fix it your self clean out built up dust inside the console and fans, and maybe apply some thermal com-paste to the cpu.
Note: This will avoid the warranty with microsoft and require a heating fan gun to dry the thermal com-paste.

Buy a new xbox 360, chances are it might happen again

But no one can handle how you spend the money, so do what you want with it =D[/quote] But microsoft know about this problem now… And they have made the new xbox slim… they should be sure that it not can happen again… So… it is a big chance for it will happen again if I buy Xbox slim?

Read full topic

item.title: Is my xbox dead forever?
item.dc:creator: @ultimatepkvillage ultimatepkvillage
item.description:
@ultimatepkvillage wrote:

[quote=“Chassy13, post:12, topic:433619”][quote author=noobs are ftw link=topic=536338.msg3921389#msg3921389 date=1329751688]
get a ps3 and dont have to worry about this
[/quote]

A PS3 can still have hardware failure, it’s just a low-rate failure console. Not to mention my friend’s PS3 is a piece of garbage and won’t start half of the time.[/quote]

Yea they can have hardware failure but those failure where mostly from the Fat Ps3 from dust build up inside the fans. I currently have the 160gb slim had it for 3 years no problems yet. And its unlikely for these ps3 console to get these failures for a long time. And the low-rate failure console is xbox dude that thing will overheat to easily ( it cost less 0= ).

Xbox Fix:

Don’t send it in not worth the money if they fix it, it probably will break down again or send a refurbished one back

Optional Try and fix it your self clean out built up dust inside the console and fans, and maybe apply some thermal com-paste to the cpu.
Note: This will avoid the warranty with microsoft and require a heating fan gun to dry the thermal com-paste.

Buy a new xbox 360, chances are it might happen again

But no one can handle how you spend the money, so do what you want with it =D

Read full topic

item.title: Is my xbox dead forever?
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

It’s almost always possible to fix, though 3 red lights indicates a general error, which could be a variety of things.

Check all the power connections and try a different socket if you have no luck.
Try it in a low temperature room as said above.

Another possibility is overheating, which is the problem mine had, well, the xbox I bought for a fiver had… applied new thermal paste to cpu and gpu and boom, xbox 360 for £5.

Read full topic

item.description:
@neroxx wrote:

[quote=“Cole1497, post:2, topic:433619”]Unplug it, place it in a low temperature area, try again in an hour or so.[/quote] Allright… If it works, Ill be happy as hell xD

Read full topic
